unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Gains Traction Across India**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Renewable Energy Gains Traction Across India**

unnormalised: Namaste folks! India's renewable energy sector is buzzing! From the deserts of Rajasthan to the backwaters of Kerala, clean energy is making waves. Dr. Sharma, a leading scientist at IIT Delhi, recently presented groundbreaking research on perovskite solar cells, potentially boosting efficiency by 15%.
normalised: Namaste folks! India's renewable energy sector is buzzing! From the deserts of Rajasthan to the backwaters of Kerala, clean energy is making waves. Doctor Sharma, a leading scientist at I I T Delhi, recently presented groundbreaking research on perovskite solar cells, potentially boosting efficiency by fifteen percent.

unnormalised: The Rajasthan government announced a new solar park project spanning 5000 acres near Jaisalmer, aiming to generate over 2000 MW of power. Down south, Tamil Nadu is investing heavily in wind energy, with new turbines popping up along the coast.
normalised: The Rajasthan government announced a new solar park project spanning five thousand acres near Jaisalmer, aiming to generate over two thousand megawatt of power. Down south, Tamil Nadu is investing heavily in wind energy, with new turbines popping up along the coast.

unnormalised: But it's not just big projects. Many smaller initiatives are blooming. Families are installing rooftop solar panels, saving Rs. 2000-3000 on their electricity bills monthly. Even small shops in bustling markets are switching to solar lighting, making a big difference collectively. It's heartening to see "atmanirbharta" (self-reliance) manifesting in sustainable energy choices, one sq ft at a time. The future is bright… and green!
normalised: But it's not just big projects. Many smaller initiatives are blooming. Families are installing rooftop solar panels, saving rupee two thousand to three thousand on their electricity bills monthly. Even small shops in bustling markets are switching to solar lighting, making a big difference collectively. It's heartening to see "atmanirbharta" (self-reliance) manifesting in sustainable energy choices, one square foot at a time. The future is bright… and green!
